alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Carbon and southwestern Monroe Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pocono Raceway, or 10 miles southwest of Mount Pocono, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kunkletown, Gilbert, Pocono Raceway, Lake Harmony, McMichael, Penn Forest Reservoir, Long Pond, Albrightsville, Kresgeville, Christmans, Sun Valley, Jonas, Meckesville, Blakeslee, Brodheadsville, Effort, Trachsville, Fiddletown and Merwinsburg. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 83 and 91. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 286 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
